author: @michaelharris2493
text: The Enable A and Enable B are used for speed control  it uses PWM and the Raspberry does not support PWM natively but you can get a servo control board for the Raspberry PI from SainSmart that has a PWM chip on it. Servo's use PWM th control the degree of motion that they move. you can connect the Enable and Enable to the Servo board to change the speed of your robot

author: @saattvikthourwal4693
text: You are wrong !! The ENA pins stand "enable" and and if you connect it to 5v it closes the circuit to the motors. Basically if we switch it on and off very fast through a PWM (Pulse With Modulation) signal you can control the speed of the motors. If you just want the motor on connect it to 5v. P.S. You cannot connect more than 2 motors to H-Bridge

author: @s3340985
text: 6:40 - you are doing it wrong. You are not supposed to connect 5V on the board to 5V on the Pi. That is a 5V OUT on the board if your power supply is 7-12V and the 12V jumper is in place (which is in place in your video)
